text: Does HubSpot tracking code have built-in consent management compatible with Google Consent Mode v2?

Hi everyone, I have added a "Goldcast" form on page. It was all working fine till yesterday, but today I get this error and no registrations are possible:

Access to fetch at '<https://backend.goldcast.io/core/user/internal_registration/>' from origin '<https://dta8euw1l8gvs.cloudfront.net>' has been blocked by CORS policy: Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. If an opaque response serves your needs, set the request's mode to 'no-cors' to fetch the resource with CORS disabled.

Any idea?

Wow, this new docs beta is looking so awesome!! :tada:

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/>
What email address can I use to contact support, please?

While authenticating HubSpot through the developer account we got an error stating -

"Scopes are not authorized"

But we have added all the required scopes and the same is working in the Production account.

Can anyone help me  on how to debug this?

Hi Fabrizio! good to know we are not alone :smile:
by "_but the problem is that if the user rejects the cookies the tracking is being triggered."_ *it means that we successfully implemented the do no track code in the initial page, but if people rejects the cookies HubSpot activates the tracking (that should only happen if they accept)*
Is there a support channel where developers can contact HubSpot for assistance?

My listing in the HubSpot Solutions Directory has disappeared! Who should I speak to about this.
I had a number of 5 star reviews :cry:
is anyone having issues with the eSignature email delivery coming from a HubSpot Quote??
I'm having a problem where you verify to sign -- but the customer never gets that email

Does anyone have any recommended tools for tracking qa of pages, workflows, emails? Basically looking for a checklist that someone can walk through to approve. It would be great to have checklists for different disciplines, technical, editorial review, design, and then final review by managers. Thank you
<http://help.HubSpot.com|help.HubSpot.com> is your best bet
You might look into creating Playbooks for these.  <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/playbooks/use-playbooks>
Thank you Scott for you interesting solution. Will look into it

Hey everyone, curious about how you typically approach making code changes to modules on live websites safely? Pull the theme into local and deploy a new instance where you can develop and test? Do the work on the live site and put up a 'In Development' notice? Thanks!
That worked Great <@UJAPS2K4N>
just need to show the events now -- somehow
the crm cards run in a sandbox so it's unlikely this would be possible

I've installed Cloud Files and have the dataroom URL outputted to a contact property. Now I'm trying to figure out how to use that property to either embed the URL or create a module for a client portal behind a membership login. I've attempted various methods for CTAs, buttons, and images, but none seem to work as they all require a properly formatted URL and won’t accept the personalization token. I know there is a way  to use the CloudFiles API to build a CMS module but it requires an Enterprise license which we can not do. Any ideas would be appreciated
hum.... did you implement custom code? perhaps that's worth sharing may it's a bug of the custom solution.

Hi everyone!
I am trying to verify the Domain name in our OAuth app and have added the value in the DNS Settings of the domain as well, but it’s still not getting verified. Can anyone help me in this issue as to what I may be missing or who I can connect with in the HubSpot team to get this resolved?

Thanks

Hi Cassie,
Usually, I do all changes locally and test on my dev accounts. Once everything is safe, I upload that module to the live site using CLI commands
